But they are also hyper-sensitive to the risk that a platform may fail them, or ultimately screw them over

1088454606483447810.text: Both at the application layer (e.g., cryptokitties, numerai, augur) and at the blockchain layer (bitcoin, ethereum, eos, etc), this tension is playing out, and it will be interesting to see what will ultimately become a new paradigm for developing platforms and apps take shape

1088454604449210368.text: This presents a challenge when trying to find product-market-fit.  Being agile means prioritizing user experience, but retaining control.  Being decentralized means prioritizing security and handing over control

1088454602620493826.text: In a nutshell: On the one hand, we have the "agile" approach to building apps: start small and iterate quickly.  On the other hand, we have "immutable" decentralized systems, which are -- by design -- stable and hard to change.

1004717426385326082.text: Expecting slow (if any) progress in a difficult situation is a difficult thing to calibrate your expectations toward.  But like all investments, gains are compounded and in the best cases can accelerate over time.https://twitter.com/nickgrossman/status/1004716947999789057 …

1004716947999789057.text: Throughout all the hard things, even the hardest things, is that there is usually not a silver bullet quick fix.  Instead, steady effort, attention and accountability (to yourself and others) enable step by step, grind it out progress.  Expect progress to be slow.https://twitter.com/nickgrossman/status/1004716500962480128 …
